awd_titl_txt: RIA:  Wavelet Based Multi-Channel Subband Image Restoration
awd_abstract_narration: Galatsanos         The research is exploring a novel, multi-channel approach to  the image restoration problem that utilizes a wavelet-based  subband decomposition. Such a decomposition facilitates the  incorporation of localized space-variant statistics and prior  knowledge into the restoration process as well as adaptive noise  suppression at various resolution levels.  Furthermore, it can be  implemented in a practical and computationally efficient manner.         In order to fully exploit the potential advantages of this  approach, three classes of multi-channel restoration algorithms  are being considered:  1.     stochastic restoration algorithms where the multi-channel  statistics of the wavelet-based subbands are used to model the  space-varying nature of the original image;  2.     deterministic algorithms where multi-channel regularization  operators and parameters are used; and  3.     hierarchical image restoration where the image is  progressively restored starting from its coarse features and  continuing to the finer ones.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
